gw.plugin.eventhandler

Interface IEventHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IEventHandler
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    The IEventHandler plugin provides hooks for either events that require feedback from customer-provided logic, or are too complex to be handled using pre-update or event message rules.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeStartDelinquencyProcessing

        void beforeStartDelinquencyProcessing(DelinquencyTarget[] delinquencies)
        Event fired before starting delinquency processing of newly delinquent entities.
        Parameters:
        delinquencies - entities which are past due and do not have an active delinquency process

      • beforePolicyPeriodClosed

        java.lang.Boolean beforePolicyPeriodClosed(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Event fired immediately before a policy period is closed.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - the policy period which is about to be closed
        Returns:
        true if the policy period should be closed. A null return value is interpreted as false.

      • canStartDelinquencyProcess

        java.lang.Boolean canStartDelinquencyProcess(DelinquencyTarget target)
        Event fired when a delinquency target has overdue amount exceeding the its delinquency plan's "start delinquency" threshold, and is otherwise considered delinquent by the standard criteria. This method provides a hook for the implementor to exclude a delinquency target from delinquency processing using more sophisticated criteria.
        Parameters:
        target - delinquencyTarget which is considered delinquent by standard criteria
        Returns:
        true if the target should be considered delinquent and undergo delinquency processing

      • calculateAccountDelinquentAmountOverrideValue

        MonetaryAmount calculateAccountDelinquentAmountOverrideValue(Account account)
        The Account.getDelinquentAmount() domain method calls out to this function. If this function returns a non null value, then Account.getDelinquentAmount() will use the value returned from this function instead of computing the delinquent amount on its own.
        Parameters:
        account - for which an override value for Account.getDelinquentAmount() will be calculated
        Returns:
        calculated account delinquent amount to use as an override of the out of the box calculated account delinquent amount, or null if the out of the box calculated delinquent amount should be used
        See Also:
        TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount()

      • calculateAccountPoliciesDelinquentAmountOverrideValue

        MonetaryAmount calculateAccountPoliciesDelinquentAmountOverrideValue(Account account)
        The Account.getPoliciesDelinquentAmount() domain method calls out to this function. If this function returns a non null value, then Account.getPoliciesDelinquentAmount() will use the value returned from this function instead of computing the delinquent amount on its own.
        Parameters:
        account - for which an override value for Account.getPoliciesDelinquentAmount() will be calculated
        Returns:
        calculated policies delinquent amount to use as an override of the out of the box calculated policies delinquent amount, or null if the out of the box calculated delinquent amount should be used
        See Also:
        Account.getPoliciesDelinquentAmount()

      • calculateAccountRawDelinquentAmountOverrideValue

        MonetaryAmount calculateAccountRawDelinquentAmountOverrideValue(Account account)
        The Account.getRawDelinquentAmount() domain method calls out to this function. If this function returns a non null value, then Account.getRawDelinquentAmount() will use the value returned from this function instead of computing the delinquent amount on its own.
        Parameters:
        account - for which an override value for Account.getRawDelinquentAmount() will be calculated
        Returns:
        calculated account raw delinquent amount to use as an override of the out of the box calculated account raw delinquent amount, or null if the out of the box calculated delinquent amount should be used
        See Also:
        Account.getRawDelinquentAmount()

      • calculatePolicyPeriodDelinquentAmountOverrideValue

        MonetaryAmount calculatePolicyPeriodDelinquentAmountOverrideValue(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        The TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount() domain method calls out to this function when the tAccountOwner is a PolicyPeriod. If this function returns a non null value, then TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount() will use the value returned from this function instead of computing the policy period delinquent amount on its own.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - for which an override value for TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount() will be calculated
        Returns:
        calculated tAccountOwner delinquent amount to use as an override of the out of the box calculated policy period delinquent amount, or null if the out of the box calculated delinquent amount should be used
        See Also:
        TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount()

      • calculateCollateralDelinquentAmountOverrideValue

        MonetaryAmount calculateCollateralDelinquentAmountOverrideValue(Collateral collateral)
        The TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount() domain method calls out to this function when the tAccountOwner is a Collateral. If this function returns a non null value, then TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount() will use the value returned from this function instead of computing the collateral delinquent amount on its own.
        Parameters:
        collateral - for which an override value for TAccountOwner.getRawDelinquentAmount() will be calculated
        Returns:
        calculated tAccountOwner delinquent amount to use as an override of the out of the box calculated collateral delinquent amount, or null if the out of the box calculated delinquent amount should be used
        See Also:
        TAccountOwner.getDelinquentAmount()

      • policyPeriodTransferredToNewProducer

        void policyPeriodTransferredToNewProducer(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                        ProducerCode oldProducerCode,
                                        ProducerCode newProducerCode)
        Event fired when a policy period is transferred to a new producer
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - the Policy Period being transferred.
        oldProducerCode - the Producer that previously had the Policy Period
        newProducerCode - the new Producer to which the Policy Period is being transferred.

      • validateManualDisbursementAmount

        java.lang.Boolean validateManualDisbursementAmount(MonetaryAmount amount,
                                                 MonetaryAmount unapplied,
                                                 MonetaryAmount pendingDisbursement,
                                                 Disbursement disbursement)
        Event fired when a manual disbursement is attempted.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be disbursed
        unapplied - the amount available in the owner's (Account or Producer) unapplied T-account
        pendingDisbursement - the amount already pending disbursement for the owner
        disbursement - the disbursement to validate
        Returns:
        true if the amount is less than or equal to the amount allowed to be disbursed, false if not.

      • updateDisbursementStatusAndAmount

        void updateDisbursementStatusAndAmount(Disbursement disbursement,
                                     boolean isAboutToExecuteDisbursement)
        This method is called whenever the DisbursementBatchProcess operates on a disbursement whose due date has arrived and so is ready to be paid, or whose due date has not yet arrived and so is just pending.

        This method provides a way to update the value and status of the disbursement (adjusting it for example if unapplied fund amounts that were previously available have gone away at some point in time after the disbursement was initially created).

        Parameters:
        disbursement - the disbursement to be adjusted
        isAboutToExecuteDisbursement - True means this method is being called to update the disbursement right before it will actually be executed. False means this method is being called as part of an update to a pending disbursement that is not about to be executed (ie: a disbursement whose due date has not arrived yet).

      • rejectDisbursementBehavior

        java.lang.Boolean rejectDisbursementBehavior(Disbursement disbursementToReject)
        Event fired when a disbursement is rejected. Determines whether to ask the user if they want to put a hold on the account to prevent an automatic disbursement from being created. This method is called as part of the DisbursementDetail screen - if the method returns true, then a button will be visible allowing the user to reject the disbursement and put a hold on the account. If the method returns false, then the button will not be visible.
        Parameters:
        disbursementToReject - the disbursement that is being rejected
        Returns:
        if true is returned, then a button will be visible allowing the user to reject the disbursement and put a hold on the account. If false, then the button will be hidden on that screen. This affects the user interface code only. The return result does not define whether to put a policy hold automatically.

      • policyClosureConditionNotMet

        @Deprecated
void policyClosureConditionNotMet(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                                           PolicyClosureCondition type)
        Deprecated. (Since 8.0.0) Because failure to meet internally defined closure conditions is not an important actionable event and also because of the function's restrictive and limited functionality it is not recommended to use this plugin function
        Event fired when attempting to close a Policy Period that can't be closed. It is fired for the following reason: 1) PolicyPeriod is not fully earned (There exist ProRataCharge's on the policy which are not fully earned)
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - the Policy Period trying to be closed
        type - the reason (condition) that the Policy Period couldn't be closed.

      • matchAgencyBillSuspensePolicyPeriod

        PolicyPeriod matchAgencyBillSuspensePolicyPeriod(BaseSuspDistItem baseSuspDistItem)
        This method is called by the AgencySuspensePaymentDistributedWorker to match an AgencySuspDistItem with an actual PolicyPeriod in the system.
        Parameters:
        baseSuspDistItem - an AgencySuspDistItem instance passed in by the AgencySuspensePaymentDistributedWorker
        Returns:
        PolicyPeriod that matches the passed-in AgencySuspDistItem, or null if non matching PolicyPeriod was found

      • processAgencyBillSuspenseItemAfterPolicyMatch

        void processAgencyBillSuspenseItemAfterPolicyMatch(BaseSuspDistItem baseSuspDistItem)
        This method is called by the AgencySuspensePaymentDistributedWorker to process an AgencySuspDistItem after the suspense item has been matched up with an actual PolicyPeriod in the system
        Parameters:
        baseSuspDistItem - a suspense item which was just matched up with a policy period
